TITLE: 2007 300c chrysler with hemi; intake; custom exhaust; and programmer.
ATTR: condition: good#cylinders: 8 cylinders#drive: rwd#fuel: gas#odometer: 96000#paint color: red#size: full-size#title status: clean#transmission: automatic#type: sedan
MESSAGE: if you are looking for a sharp looking ride that gets good mileage; yet has 400 hp and will put a smile on your face every time you take off.... this  2007 chrysler 300 c with the hemi v8 is perfect for you!  this car is sleeper; meaning most people wont suspect it has such performance and power under the hood.   truly has been a great car.  no rips or tears in leather.  has tinted windows and front tint on top of front window.  still has good visibility.  front window does have a crack (had since i purchased it 5 years ago). runs like a champ and with the intake; high flow exhaust; and programmer really wakes the hemi up.  i keep the programmer on the mileage tune since i use the car for my daily driver.  even on this mild tune there is a night & day seat of the pants difference in performance and mpg.  i average 20mpg between city/highway.  has newer good year tires.  had the transmission fluid changed less then 3000 miles ago.#has 96k miles.#does have a few blemishes here and there; but looks sharp.  rear bumper has a few scratches and the drivers door handle works fine; but has a crack of which i purchased a new one but have not put it on as of writing of this ad.#good rig that will last. engine sounds amazing inside the car (not too loud; but with the intake you can hear the performance of the engine; not the exhaust); and outside you can hear v8 power.  it isnt annoying over the top look at me exhaust sound but just lets you know its alive and ready to go. really fun to drive; tons of room for 5; and a giant trunk.  cant go wrong with this 300c; and for $7800 you wont find something like it!#i will not entertain low ball offers or anything stupid.  it is priced right.  exhaust was $800; predator programmer another $400; and the intake another $300.  i know $7800 is priced with or below the other 300cs that dont have these upgrades.

TITLE: 2010 chrysler 300
ATTR: condition: excellent#cylinders: 6 cylinders#drive: rwd#fuel: gas#odometer: 93000#paint color: white#title status: lien#transmission: automatic#type: sedan
MESSAGE: im selling my chrysler 300. it has the 3.5l v6; 93k miles; aftermarket 22 rims.#pros: tires are in great condition; regular oil changes; engine and transmission are both very strong. rims have been wrapped in matte black; you can leave it or have it taken off. i had them wrapped to protect the original rims from any damage. the rims normal color is glossy black with chrome. i just had the water pump; timing belt and vehicle computer replaced. it has traction control and abs. it does okay in light snow; but could use a set of snow tires. 25% tint and the aftermarket black grille make it a pretty sharp looking ride.#cons: rear drivers side quarter panel has some scratching; nothing major. drivers seat leather has cracks and normal wear and tear. the rest of the interior is basically flawless. never smoked inside; and always taken good care of. check engine light comes on from time-to-time; code always reads as an evap leak; ive had it in my shop looked at and thats never the case. the code actually has to do with a faulty gas cap. i replaced the gas cap and the light still comes on (id say once every few months; and then goes away after a few days).#overall; the car runs great. its been my summer vehicle and hasnt seen snow since ive owned it (2 years). theres no rust; and other than a few minor things; its in great condition. this is my daily driver; so itll continue to be driven while this ad is up and im in absolutely no hurry to sell this vehicle. i wont go less than $8;500; it has a lien on it for about that. email me if youre interested; no texts or calls.
